solution_line_template: Half as many as the first plant is {first_plant_tomatoes}/{half_divisor}=<<{first_plant_tomatoes}/{half_divisor}={half_first_plant_tomatoes}>>{half_first_plant_tomatoes} tomatoes.

But the second plant produced {additional_second_plant_tomatoes} more than half as many tomatoes as the first plant., or a total of {half_first_plant_tomatoes}+{additional_second_plant_tomatoes}=<<{half_first_plant_tomatoes}+{additional_second_plant_tomatoes}={second_plant_tomatoes}>>{second_plant_tomatoes} tomatoes.

And the third plant produced {additional_third_plant_tomatoes} more tomatoes than the second plant, or {second_plant_tomatoes}+{additional_third_plant_tomatoes}=<<{second_plant_tomatoes}+{additional_third_plant_tomatoes}={third_plant_tomatoes}>>{third_plant_tomatoes} tomatoes.

In total, the three plants produced {first_plant_tomatoes}+{second_plant_tomatoes}+{third_plant_tomatoes}=<<{first_plant_tomatoes}+{second_plant_tomatoes}+{third_plant_tomatoes}={total_tomatoes}>>{total_tomatoes} tomatoes.
